text: The 2016–17 FC St. Pauli season is the club's 106th season of existence, and their sixth consecutive season in the 2. Bundesliga, the second tier of German football. == Background == After narrowingly missing out on promotion during the 2015–16 season, FC. St Pauli started to strengthen the squad in the summer to mount another push for promotion. ==Transfers== ===In=== {| class="wikitable" |- !| Position !| Name !| From !| Fee |- |GK || Jay Lee || Seattle Sounders FC 2 || free |- | FW || Waldemar Sobota || Club Brugge || € 300K |- | FW || Marvin Ducksch || Borussia Dortmund II || € 250K |- | DF || Vegar Eggen Hedenstad || SC Freiburg || free |- | MF || Christopher Avevor || Hannover 96 || free |- | DF || Jacob Rasmussen || FC Schalke 04 || free |- | MF || Richard Neudecker || TSV 1860 München || free |- | FW || Aziz Bouhaddouz || SV Sandhausen || free |- | MF || Cenk Sahin || İstanbul Başakşehir F.K. || loan |} ===Out=== {| class="wikitable" |- !| Position !| Name !| From !| Fee |- | MF || Marc Rzatkowski || Red Bull Salzburg || € 2 mln |- | FW || Ante Budimir || F.C.
